products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-slz-vsi
products.label: VSI on VPC landing zone
products.short_description: Creates a secure infrastructure with virtual servers to run your workloads on a VPC network
products.long_description: The VSI on VPC landing zone provides secure and customizable compute resources for running your applications and services. It creates secure and compliant Virtual Server Instances (VSI) on top of an existing Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network.

features.description: Creates and configures one or more virtual servers to handle workloads.
features.title: Creates virtual servers for workloads

features.description: Configures the subnets for the VSIs and specifies which subnets the instances are deployed in.
features.title: Configures subnets

features.description: Associates security groups with the VSIs to control inbound and outbound traffic to instances.
features.title: Associates security groups

features.description: Provisions and manages SSH keys for the VSIs so that you can securely administer the instances.
features.title: Provisions SSH keys

module "landing-zone" {

  ibmcloud_api_key = var.ibmcloud_api_key

  prefix           = "slz"
}

diagram.caption: VSI on VPC landing zone - QuickStart variation

diagrams.description: The QuickStart variation of the VSI on VPC landing zone deployable architecture creates a fully customizable Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) environment in a single region. The solution provides virtual servers in a secure VPC for your workloads. The QuickStart variation is designed to deploy quickly for demonstration and development.

products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-slz-vpc
products.label: VPC landing zone
products.short_description: Deploys a secure VPC network without compute resources
products.long_description: The VPC landing zone deployable architecture deploys a simple Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) infrastructure without any compute resources, such as Virtual Server Instances (VSI) or Red Hat OpenShift clusters. You can use this architecture as a base on which to deploy compute resources. Or you can deploy those resources by using the other landing zone deployable architectures: VSI on VPC landing zone and Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform on VPC landing zone.

features.description: Creates a VPC-based topology based on two VPCs, by default.
features.title: Creates Virtual Private Clouds

features.description: Defines multiple subnets in the VPC to define IP ranges and organize resources within the network.
features.title: Configures subnets

features.description: The transit gateway connects the two default VPCs that the deployable architecture creates.
features.title: Creates a transit gateway

features.description: IBM Cloud Object Storage is used for Flow Logs and Activity Tracker, which enhance the observability and auditing of your infrastructure.
features.title: Integrates Flow Logs and Activity tracking

features.description: Isolates and speeds traffic to the public internet by using an edge VPC in a specific location, if enabled.
features.title: Supports edge networking

diagrams.description: The Standard variation of the VPC landing zone deployable architecture deploys a simple Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) infrastructure without any compute resources. You can use this architecture as a base on which to deploy compute resources. The Standard variation uses two Virtual Private Clouds (VPC) - a Management VPC and a Workload VPC - to manage the environment and the deployed workload. Each VPC is a multi-zoned, multi-subnet implementation that keeps your workloads secure. A transit gateway connects the VPCs to each other and Virtual Private Endpoints are used connect to IBM Cloud services.

products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-slz-ocp
products.label: Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform on VPC landing zone
products.short_description: Creates Red Hat OpenShift workload clusters on a secure VPC network
products.long_description: The Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform on VPC landing zone provides the tools to deploy a Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform cluster in a single Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network. The VPC is a multi-zoned, multi-subnet implementation that keeps your VPC secure and highly available.

features.description: Creates and configures one or more clusters to handle workloads. You can specify the version and cluster size.
features.title: Creates Open Shift Container Platform clusters for workloads

features.description: With worker pools, you can group and manage worker nodes with similar configurations, such as compute resources and availability zones.
features.title: Creates worker pools

features.description: Configures the subnets for the cluster, and specifies the subnets to deploy the worker nodes in.
features.title: Configures subnets for containers

features.description: Configures private and public endpoints for the cluster.
features.title: Supports private and public endpoints

features.description: Configures the ingress controller for the cluster, responsible for routing external traffic to the appropriate services within the cluster.
features.title: Configures ingress
